profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 16:34:36 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, printed material, photographs, and receipts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files regarding compiling an art collection for the new bank building, including Alexander Calder's "Eagle." Files contain correspondence, art committee reports, photographs of Calder's work, dedication ceremony speeches, catalogs, clippings and biographical material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Art collection acquisition files containing clippings, press releases, receipts, and photographs of Calder's "Eagle" installation.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels 1909 and 1912-1913 available for use through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals returned to the lender, Lewis H. Bond, after microfilming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Fort Worth National Bank (founded 1873) formed an art collection for its new building in Fort Worth, Texas.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Lent for microfilming, 1980, by Lewis H. Bond, Chairman of the Board of Texas American Bankshares, as part of the Archives of American Art's Texas project.
